document.title: English Language Proficiency Assessment for the 21st Century

97C60E8CDC3D4052BD79E4643B25974C.description:
An ELL can make accurate use of
standard English to
communicate in grade appropriate
speech and
writing.

A9E89621ABB449689EDBD77EBC007E56.description:
An ELL can create clear and
coherent grade appropriate
speech and
text.

356BCC32B0C747BEB3BC65D1801B891F.description:
An ELL can determine the meaning
of words and phrases
in oral presentations
and literary and
informational text.

6A34849BF3504114A4588D99D526A75C.description:
An ELL can adapt language choices
to purpose, task, and
audience when
speaking and writing.

DEFA0A5412EC4F15AE8E4540887CC3B7.description:
An ELL can analyze and critique
the arguments of
others orally and in
writing.

8393B4DEAC494D25A8D796BFE17500C1.description:
An ELL can conduct research and
evaluate and
communicate findings
to answer questions or
solve problems.

85030A1FD77B4B5BB447C873EE36B9B9.description:
An ELL can construct grade appropriate
oral and
written claims and
support them with
reasoning and
evidence.

65740C03DCC3487C844007C7C4C73C06.description:
An ELL can speak and write about
grade-appropriate
complex literary and
informati

A489068BAED841D4B14C46D8A16997D5.description:
An ELL can participate in grade appropriate
oral and
written exchanges of
information, ideas, and
analyses, responding to
peer, audience, or
reader comments and
questions.

0D296A06773E4DF9B8254EE5792DF437.description:
An ELL can construct meaning from
oral presentations and
literary and
informational text
through grade appropriate
listening,
reading, and viewing.
